div.p: Mention the Project and employee that require Tools for clients projects.

sheet.script: alert('Hi there!\nThis JavaScript is going off from within the XML file!')

ul.li: Click Next To Enlist All Tools hold by Selected Employee
From tools list shown below, remove tools that are not returned now

field.name: help
field.p: Click me! This will show you the CSS demo.

div.p: Initiate your Material Request process. Material should be reconcile on same form.

group.p: State Confirm Mean Transaction is successfully completed

field.name: help
field.p: Click to add a new version.
Define here the different versions of your products on which you can work on issues and return.

ul.li: Task template can be used in project.
You can create predefine task including activities with budget hours
Select a default user e.g Technician
This user will appear with task activities in task template
You can change this user Technician in actual project when template is loaded
Initially planned hours should not exceed project total hours.
Each Task belongs to a project type shown above.
After giving a task name, define task activities in the following list.
Assign expected user and time required for each task and its activities.

div.p: Add Client material to existing stock,Use the same form to handover back to client

field.name: help
field.p: Click to add a new version.
Define here the different versions of your tools on which you can work on issues.

tree.colors: name == 'Project is closed',red:name == 'Project is Canceled',green:name == 'Project is Re-Opened'

label.style: color: white; background-color: Red; font-weight: bold; padding: 4px 4.9em; border-radius: 14px; box-shadow: 0 24px 24px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.2),0 40px 77px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.22)!important;
color: white; background-color: Green; font-weight: bold; padding: 4px 4.9em; border-radius: 14px; box-shadow: 0 24px 24px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.2),0 40px 77px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.22)!important;
